Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pumpernickel \Pump"er*nick`el\, n. [G.] A sort of bread, made of unbolted rye, which forms the chief food of the Westphalian peasants. It is acid but nourishing. [1913 Webster]
pumpernickel n : bread made of coarse rye flour [syn: {black bread}]
